byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner and Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Michael R. Gordon from Geneva.

abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, addressing joint meeting of Congress, strongly warns of a 'bad deal' being negotiated with Iran over its nuclear program; speech divides Democrats and Republicans, with more than 50 Democrats not attending; Pres Obama rejects address as 'theater' and 'nothing new.'
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said that negotiations over Iran’s nuclear program were proceeding on a false hope that Iran is acting in good faith. President Obama dismissed the speech as “theater.”

headline.main: In Congress, Netanyahu Faults ‘Bad Deal’ on Iran Nuclear Program
headline.print_headline: In Congress, Netanyahu Faults ‘Bad Deal’ on Iran
headline.sub: Prime Minister Faults U.S. on Nuclear Proposal

snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said that negotiations over Iran’s nuclear program were proceeding on a false hope that Iran is acting in good faith. President Obama dismissed the speech as “theater.”
